rounds.category: YOUR FACE IS ON THE MONEY

clues.text: In India in 1996 a series of bank notes across 7 denominations all featured portraits of this man of peace
Wilfrid Laurier's resemblance to this actor enabled Canadians to "Spock your fives" even before his passing in 2015
He was on every Chinese bank note 1999-2008, when he lost face on 6 million pieces issued for the Beijing Olympics
This man who came to power in 1979 is on Iran's 100,000-rial note
Mexico's 500-peso note features these 2 painters, husband & wife
Tywin Lannister's 3 scheming offspring on "Games of Thrones" are Jaime, Cersei & this one
Lamont was the responsible son to his wild & wacky father played by Redd Foxx on this sitcom
On this '90s show Manhattanite Maxwell Sheffield had help with his kids from Fran Fine of Queens
Ward was the first name of the father portrayed by Hugh Beaumont on this TV show
Corey Stoll plays Dr. Ephraim Goodweather, raising his son & fighting a vampire plague on this FX show
Hammerin' Hank is a nickname for both Hank Greenberg & this other Baseball Hall of Famer
The flag of the USSR had this pair in the upper hoist corner underneath a 5-pointed star
His hammer has a name, Mjolnir, & marvelous qualities, including returning to the thrower like a boomerang
The actor who played the Winklevoss twins & the Lone Ranger is the great-grandson of this oil tycoon
For some serious demo, the Nupla tool company makes a double-faced this type of hammer up to 20 pounds
Proverbs warns that mocking your parents will result in these crowlike birds pecking out your eyes
Of the 4 creatures God sent as plagues upon the Egyptians, the one that isn't an insect
In Genesis 32 this man gives his angry brother goats, camels & donkeys in an attempt to calm him
In Mark 16 Jesus tells his followers that they will be able to handle these deadly animals without fear
This man is repaid for his faith when God gives him 14,000 sheep & 1,000 oxen
Ash clouds from an Indonesian volcano led to 10 inches of snow in the U.S. in June, typifying the "year without" this
Argentinians declared independence as Las Provincias Unidas del this rio
This man's opera "The Barber of Seville" premiered in Rome
In Philadelphia Richard Allen & others organized this first independent black U.S. church, the A.M.E.
In 1816 the USA's first protective tariff helped launch the contented & isolationist Era of these

rounds.category: A QUICK DIP IN THE LAKE

clues.text: In area, it's the largest inland saline body of water in North America
Biwa, Japan's largest lake, was long noted for culturing these gems
From the CN Tower you get a good view of this 7,340-square-mile lake
About 420 miles long, it bears the name of a former African country
Also beginning with "La" is this Russian lake, the largest entirely in Europe

rounds.category: YOU NEED FOOD TO GROW ON

clues.text: They're high in good carbs & a great source of fiber, so go for garbanzo beans, aka these
Men's Health says get bigger by eating pineapple to boost the pituitary gland's production of this, abbrev. HGH
Order the sheepshead; like most of these animals, it's a good source of omega-3 fatty acids
This "homey" food, aka Dutch cheese, is high in casein, a slow-digesting protein; it lends its name to less desirable "thighs"
The people behind the slogan "the incredible edible" this food want you to know it helps you grow
It's the symbol over the one on your computer keyboard
This type of "calorie" has no real nutritional value
Fit to be chosen, like the bachelors on that show
Storywise, TV dramas are usually dubbed either "serial" or this kind
From Latin for "to instruct", it means "learned" or "scholarly"
In this novel we see the city through the eyes of young Holden Caulfield
E.L. Doctorow's "The Waterworks" is a Gothic thriller set during this man's corrupt 19th century rule of the city
Suze Rotolo's "A Freewheelin' Time" is a memoir of her life in the 1960s Greenwich Village folk scene with this boyfriend
The New York Times called "One Fifth Avenue" a "glossy new offering" from this "Sex and the City" scribe
This Jay McInerney novel evoked the yuppie party scene of 1980s New York City
Pillsbury trademarked this term for a type of contest it has been holding since 1949
Historically, these Germanic people lived in & ruled England & Wales until the Norman conquest
The name of this figure in square dancing comes from a corruption of the French for "back to back"
From 1955 until he retired in 1979, George Meany was the president of this union
During the Revolution, Thomas Paine was this type of French-named military assistant to Gen. Nathanael Greene

rounds.comments: (Alex: But each correct response will not end with an "S".  It'll begin with the letter "S".)

clues.text: Collectively it's made up of the cranial bones & most of the facial bones
The top 7 ribs on each side attach to this bone in the center of your thorax
The bones of the shoulder are the humerus, the clavicle & the shoulder blade, aka this bone
Together with the malleus & the incus, this tiny bone forms the middle ear
This bone attached at the hips helps form the pelvis

rounds.text: This West African country of 12 million doesn't border the 1,200-mile-wide gulf of the same name
